oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-12-19 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 19, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys fronted by Eddy Arnold, Art Wooten, Minnie Pearl, Pap's Jug Band, and Tex Summey. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Art Wooten; Minnie Pearl; Pap's Jug Band; Tex Summey; Roy Acuff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Art Wooten -- Arkansas Traveler (Art Wooten) -- George D. Hay introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Jealous Hearted Me (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Pap's Jug Band -- Oh! Susanna (Pap's Jug Band) -- George D. Hay introduces Tex Summey -- Careless Love (Tex Summey) -- George D. Hay introduces Art Wooten -- Durang's Hornpipe (Art Wooten) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Minnie Pearl; Wooten, Art, 1906-1986; Stewart, Redd; Summey, James Clell, 1919-1975; Cousin Jody
